results.title: On the trail of the torturers
results.creator_credit: Michael Ryan and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
As Greece prepares for its first democratic election in a decade, “World in Action” focuses on the torturers who were recruited by the former dictatorship to “discourage” opposition. This is a powerful and confronting documentary containing graphic accounts by both the torturers and the victims of torture.

results.title: Tip of the iceberg
results.creator_credit: Steve Morrison and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”
The problem of toxic industrial waste poses environmental problems around the world. This film investigates the dangers of the dumping of tons of toxic waste on an industrial tip near the Avon Age fortress of Sutton Walls, Hertfordshire, and near farmland in Matlock, Derbyshire.
results.description:

results.title: Killer dust: a standard mistake?
results.creator_credit: Alan Segal and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Twenty thousand workers in the asbestos industry in Britain alone risk contracting fatal lung diseases - including lung cancer. This film indicates that the safety level is far too low. One solution to the problem may be to abandon some asbestos products.
results.description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.

results.title: The Dumping grounds
results.creator_credit: John Shepherd, Leslie Woodhead and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Looks at the issue of the makeshift Bantu reservations to which the South African Government is transporting whole communities in furtherance of its “separate development” policy. Reveals an appalling catalogue of mismanagement and neglect on the part of those responsible for this mass transportation of people - and on the Bantu side a total crushing despair.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Shepherd, Leslie Woodhead and Granada Television International
results.description:

results.title: The Peace War
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
The Peace War looks at the growing power of peace movements in Europe and the propaganda victories won by the proponents of nuclear disarmament. Examines the arguments for and against the Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament in Britain.
results.description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.

results.title: Sex and violence
results.creator_credit: Linda McDoogall and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
The anti-rape movement in the United States is of concern to the feminist movement. Shows the activities of rape crisis centres and in particular deals with the activities of the organisation Women Organised Against Rape, which is based in Philadelphia, and handles l,000 rape cases a year.
results.description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
The anti-rape movement in the United States is of concern to the feminist movement. Shows the activities of rape crisis centres and in particular deals with the activities of the organisation Women Organised Against Rape, which is based in Philadelphia, and handles l,000 rape cases a year.

results.title: The Silent epidemic
results.creator_credit: David Mills and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Alzheimer’s Disease is a fatal illness few people have heard of, yet as many as one in twelve old people in Britain are likely to contract it and thousands of young people also suffer from it. The fact that its symptoms - confusion, loss of memory, aggression and incontinence - are similar to those of old age has allowed it to be largely ignored by the medical profession.

results.title: VD: don't take the risk
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”
Statistics show that venereal disease rates are rising, particularly among teenagers; teenagers explain how they become affected, and later describe their experiences in clinics. A lecture, sensibly frank and usefully informative in respect to symptoms, is heard and discussed by a mixed sixth form; a doctor gives further information about the spread of the disease and clinical procedure.
Follow-up to previous Granada program “The Shadow of ignorance: an inquiry”.

results.title: The Last refuge
results.creator_credit: Michael Beckham and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Examines Paraguay under the Stroessner regime emphasising the regime’s corruption, use of torture and repression, and asylum for some of the world’s most wanted men. Exposes a number of personalities including ex-Nazi Adolf Mengele.

results.title: The Man who stole Uganda
results.creator_credit: John Sheppard and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Uganda’s General Milton Obote was deposed by his own army. It took Major General Idi Amin, self-appointed Head of Army and State, just one week to take charge of key services and installations. Behind this well-organised takeover lies a history of military corruption.
results.description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
